body.head.byline: By ALLISON FASS AND LIZ MURRAY

block.p: SOME of them lived on Staten Island and others were born in the minds of Staten Islanders. So among the celebrities featured in the exhibition ''Famous People From Staten Island'' are such varied figures as Dorothy Day and Cornelius Vanderbilt (both at right), Donald Trump and Mr. Clean.

The show, at the Staten Island Institute of Arts and Sciences through Sept. 4, provides a window into the lives of these personalities through photographs, vintage periodicals and other historical memorabilia. The list also extends to Joan Baez, Paul Newman, Martin Sheen, Samuel I. Newhouse, St. Elizabeth Ann Seton, Frederick Law Olmsted, Aaron Burr and Bert and Harry Piel of beer advertising fame.

SOME of them lived on Staten Island and others were born in the minds of Staten Islanders. So among the celebrities featured in the exhibition ''Famous People From Staten Island'' are such varied figures as Dorothy Day and Cornelius Vanderbilt (both at right), Donald Trump and Mr. Clean.

The show, at the Staten Island Institute of Arts and Sciences through Sept. 4, provides a window into the lives of these personalities through photographs, vintage periodicals and other historical memorabilia. The list also extends to Joan Baez, Paul Newman, Martin Sheen, Samuel I. Newhouse, St. Elizabeth Ann Seton, Frederick Law Olmsted, Aaron Burr and Bert and Harry Piel of beer advertising fame.

The show delves into society's celebrity culture, the changes brought on by the latest technological developments, how celebrity admiration might change further, and what all that reflects about Americans as a people.

''Famous People From Staten Island'' through Sept. 4; Staten Island Institute of Arts and Sciences, 75 Stuyvesant Place, near Wall Street; 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Saturday, and from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. on Sunday; suggested donation $2.50 for adults, $1.50 for students and people 60 or over, and free for members; (718) 727-1135 x21.
